publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4600 Ms Sandra White: Trident Replacement—That the Parliament notes with great concern Labour Chancellor Gordon Brown’s decision that he will keep and renew Trident nuclear weapons at a cost of up to £25 billion and believes that the Scottish Parliament should hold a referendum of the Scottish people regarding Trident and nuclear weapons in Scotland. Supported by: Campbell Martin*, Jim Mather*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*, Brian Adam*, Chris Ballance*, Alex Neil*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-4600 Ms Sandra White: Trident Replacement—That the Parliament notes with great concern Labour Chancellor Gordon Brown’s decision that he will keep and renew Trident nuclear weapons at a cost of up to £25 billion and believes that the Scottish Parliament should hold a referendum of the Scottish people regarding Trident and nuclear weapons in Scotland. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Jim Mather, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Brian Adam, Chris Ballance, Alex Neil, Carolyn Leckie, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-4600 Trident Replacement (lodged on 22 June 2006) Rosie Kane*
S2M-4600 Trident Replacement (lodged on 22 June 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*, John Swinburne*, Eleanor Scott*, Frances Curran* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4600 Trident Replacement (lodged on 22 June 2006) Ms Maureen Watt* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4600 Trident Replacement (lodged on 22 June 2006) Shiona Baird* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4600 Trident Replacement (lodged on 22 June 2006) Roseanna Cunningham* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
